programme.desc: While decommissioning an old nuclear missile, an accident causes the team to endure exposure to toxic vapor while trying to prevent the nuke from detonating; Paige confronts Happy about constantly tagging along with her and Walter.

programme.desc: While attending a tech convention, Team Scorpion is taken hostage by a group attempting a virtual heist.

programme.desc: At Halloween, the team takes on a case to prove the existence of ghosts on the Queen Mary but find a ship on a deadly collision course; Walter considers taking note of Paige's interests to benefit their relationship.

programme.desc: A device that can prevent a nuclear meltdown is tracked through the Los Angeles sewers; Walter learns to listen and not offer advice to Paige; the team meets their new neighbor.

programme.desc: Team Scorpion visits a renaissance festival, but the revelry is cut short when a group tries to rob a nearby police evidence locker; Paige grows weary of Walter pointing out the historical inaccuracies at the festival.

programme.desc: Team Scorpion tries to help a father and his daughter when their plane crashes nearby; Paige helps Walter navigate his feelings about Cabe's possible future in prison.

programme.desc: The team devises a plan to use a donated cadaver to draw out Pelant; Sweets returns to work and believes Agent Flynn isn't who he seems.

programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a high school principal who was dying of cancer; Brennan and Booth plan their wedding; a virtual profiling system threatens Sweets' job.

programme.desc: The team tries to keep the details of an investigation away from Brennan so she will focus on her wedding; Max shows up with a suspicious bag of cash.

programme.desc: Unable to relax on their honeymoon, Booth and Brennan decide to help a local detective solve the murder of a Nazi war criminal; Hodgins and Angela look after Christine.

programme.desc: The team suspects that a man who made his money donating sperm was killed by a recipient who learned his records were inaccurate; Brennan enters a feud with a fellow author (Nora Dunn).

programme.desc: A key witness turns up dead in a case for which Brennan is a juror, so the team works to discover what has happened.

programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a food scientist whose body was put through a meat grinder and mixed into canned stew; Angela puts together a post-wedding bachelorette party for Brennan.

programme.desc: When a gymnast's remains are found in a park, Booth and Brennan discover she was living a double life; Cam confronts the woman who stole her identity.

programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a country music singer whose remains were found in a shallow grave; Brennan takes a look at Wendall's injuries after he breaks his arm during a hockey game.
